intro: Galium parisiense var. decipiens, commonly known as the false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically followed by small, three-lobed berries. Its leaves are opposite, heart-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
